trans-unit.source: This sample demonstrates how to use the custom activity, `GetWorkflowInstanceId` to return the workflow instance ID.
Custom activity development, how to access the workflow instance.
Getting the instance ID of a running workflow requires writing code.

If you want to write a fully-declarative workflow, then you need an activity that can return the workflow instance ID so that the activity can be referenced in the workflow to provide a fully-declarative workflow authoring experience.

Many scenarios require access to the instance ID: a few examples are for logging or auditing purposes or for doing application-level correlation by providing the instance ID back to a client for future association (for example, by using this activity inside a SendReply activity).

`GetWorkflowInstanceId` is implemented as a <xref:System.Activities.CodeActivity%601> because it must return a value of type <xref:System.Guid>, and it must have access to the <xref:System.Activities.CodeActivityContext> for getting the workflowâ€™s instance ID.
